headline: Warner Bros Rejects CNN Sale Talk as $1.8 Billion Revenue Sharpens Valuation Debate
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery says CNN is not for sale despite Barry Diller interest, as the company prepares its split and defends Discovery Global's value.

raw.headline: Warner Bros Rejects CNN Sale Talk as $1.8 Billion Revenue Sharpens Valuation Debate

headline: Here’s What Lifted Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) in Q4
summary: Greenlight Capital, an investment management company, released its fourth-quarter 2025 investor letter. A copy of the letter can be downloaded here. Greenlight Capital’s investment strategy focuses on constructing a bottom-up portfolio comprising undervalued long positions and overvalued short positions, while also including a macro book to hedge risks and capture insights. The Partnership returned 9.0% […]

headline: Netflix’s $82.7b Warner Bros. Bid Tests Valuation, Growth And Deal Risks
summary: Netflix has announced an $82.7b all cash bid to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery, the largest media deal in its history. The proposed transaction comes during active regulatory scrutiny in the US and UK and competing interest from other bidders, including Paramount Skydance. The deal is intended to expand Netflix's content library and competitive position while raising questions about media consolidation. Netflix, listed as NasdaqGS:NFLX, is moving forward with this proposed acquisition while...

headline: Netflix And Warner Bros. Discovery Discover A New Path Forward
summary: Netflix (NFLX) rated Hold on rich valuation despite AI-led innovation; Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) a soft Buy on spin-off optionality. Read the full analysis here.

headline: Barry Diller sought to buy CNN from Warner Bros. Discovery, sources say
summary: CNN is not for sale, the company reiterated Wednesday after a news report about media mogul Barry Diller’s interest in buying the cable network from Warner Bros. Discovery.

raw.headline: Barry Diller sought to buy CNN from Warner Bros. Discovery, sources say
raw.summary: CNN is not for sale, the company reiterated Wednesday after a news report about media mogul Barry Diller’s interest in buying the cable network from Warner Bros. Discovery.

headline: Barry Diller Told Warner Discovery He Is Interested in Buying CNN
summary: A Warner spokesman said CNN “was not and is not for sale.” The overture adds a new twist to the biggest takeover drama in the media industry in years.

raw.headline: Barry Diller Told Warner Discovery He Is Interested in Buying CNN
raw.summary: A Warner spokesman said CNN “was not and is not for sale.” The overture adds a new twist to the biggest takeover drama in the media industry in years.
